Text: NCPA Response and Objections to CSG First Data RequestAttached is NCPAs Response and Objections to the First Joint Data Request of the Competitive Supplier Group to the NonPublic Utilities If you have any questions please feel free to contact me Meg Meiser Spiegel McDiarmid New York Avenue NW Washington DC certificatepdf NCPA Response to CSGdoc

NCPA Testimony in ELNCPA Testimonydoc Attached is an advance copy of the testimony filed on behalf of the Northern California Power Agency today in this docket Exhibits NCP and NCP were not available in electronic format Hard copies of testimony and attached exhibits are being mailed to the restricted service list If you have any questions please contact me Meg Meiser Spiegel McDiarmid New York Avenue NW Washington DC NCPA Testimonydoc

Re EL Call on ConfidentialityCounsel for Northern California Power Agency will probably not be able to be on the call NCPA supports lifting the protective order on everything as Judge Birchman suggested as long as this change applies to every party Original Message From Jakubiak Jeffrey M mailtojeffrey ROUTMANSANDERSCOM Sent Tuesday November PM To ELLISTSERVGSAGOV Subject EL Call on Confidentiality Pursuant to our discussion on the pm call today below is dialin information for a conference call this Monday November at pm EST to discuss means to satisfying Judge Birchmans request to eliminate confidentiality concerns in the EL proceeding before him Please review prior to the call any confidential exhibits that you may have submitted in this proceeding and come with ideasproposals as to how the Judges concerns may be addressed Dial In Alternate DialIn Passcode Jeffrey Jakubiak Troutman Sanders LLP Attorney for Mirant

NCPA TestimonyYour Honor The attached letter regarding NCPAs testimony was filed today at FERC No portion of NCPAs testimony or supporting exhibits filed on November is protected Copies of the letter are being served on the parties via the listserv Young testimony not protectedDOC Young testimony not protectedDOC
